sen.j: 民俗文化財（みんぞくぶんかざい）とは、民俗資料のうち、とくに資料性が高く、保存措置が必要だったり、あるいは、保存のための措置や施策が功を奏すると期待される資料である。
sen.e: Folk-cultural properties refer to material folk-culture with a particularly high value which require preservation measures, or measures or rules for such preservation are expected to be effective.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処民俗資料：以下のmaterial folk-cultureの表現を転用しています。http://www.wipo.int/tk/en//laws/pdf/japan_cultural.pdf
sen.e: Folk-cultural properties refer to material folk-culture with a particularly high value which require preservation measures, or measures or rules for such preservation are expected to be effective.
Folk-cultural properties refer to material folk-culture with a particularly high value which require preservation measures, or measures or rules for such preservation are expected to be effective.

sen.j: 国や地方公共団体が文化遺産保護制度の一環として指定した文化財である。
sen.e: They are designated as folk-cultural properties by the Government and the local public bodies in the context of the cultural heritage protection system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are designated as folk-cultural properties by the Government and the local public bodies in the context of the cultural heritage protection system.
They are designated as folk-cultural properties by the Government and the local public bodies in the context of the cultural heritage protection system.

sen.j: 本項では主に日本における事例について述べる。
sen.e: This section mainly describes the cases in Japan.
This section mainly describes the cases in Japan.
This section mainly describes the cases in Japan.

sen.j: 日本の民俗文化財は民俗文化財有形民俗文化財と民俗文化財無形民俗文化財に大別される。
sen.e: Folk-cultural properties in Japan are roughly categorized into folk-cultural properties tangible folk-cultural properties and folk-cultural properties intangible folk-cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 民俗文化財有形民俗文化財および民俗文化財無形民俗文化財：そのまま訳出していますが、有形民俗文化財と無形民俗文化財に大別される、であると思われます。
sen.e: Folk-cultural properties in Japan are roughly categorized into folk-cultural properties tangible folk-cultural properties and folk-cultural properties intangible folk-cultural properties.
Folk-cultural properties in Japan are roughly categorized into folk-cultural properties tangible folk-cultural properties and folk-cultural properties intangible folk-cultural properties.

sen.j: それぞれに重要有形民俗文化財、重要無形民俗文化財の指定制度があり、指定制度を補完するものとして登録有形民俗文化財と選択無形民俗文化財（通称）がある。
sen.e: The categories have a designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties and important intangible folk-cultural properties, complemented by registered tangible folk-cultural properties and (commonly called) selected intangible folk-cultural properties, respectively.

The categories have a designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties and important intangible folk-cultural properties, complemented by registered tangible folk-cultural properties and (commonly called) selected intangible folk-cultural properties, respectively.

The categories have a designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties and important intangible folk-cultural properties, complemented by registered tangible folk-cultural properties and (commonly called) selected intangible folk-cultural properties, respectively.

sen.j: 保護のしかたや取り扱いには違いがある。
sen.e: They are protected and managed in different manners.
They are protected and managed in different manners.
They are protected and managed in different manners.

tit.j: 日本における民俗文化財制度の整備
tit.e: Establishment of the folk-cultural property system in Japan
Establishment of the folk-cultural property system in Japan
Establishment of the folk-cultural property system in Japan

sen.j: 日本において、民俗文化財が文化財保護の対象となったのは、1950年（昭和25年）の文化財保護法制定においてであった。
sen.e: In Japan, folk-cultural properties became the cultural properties to be protected when the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties was enacted in 1950.
In Japan, folk-cultural properties became the cultural properties to be protected when the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was enacted in 1950.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties(日本法令外国語訳データベースシステム)
sen.e: In Japan, folk-cultural properties became the cultural properties to be protected when the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was enacted in 1950.

sen.j: このとき、現在の民俗文化財は「民俗資料」として「建造物」や「美術工芸品」と並んだ有形文化財のひとつとされた。
sen.e: On this occasion, the present-day folk-cultural properties were designated as 'material folk-culture,' and included in tangible cultural properties along with 'buildings' and 'applied arts.'
On this occasion, the present-day folk-cultural properties were designated as 'folklore materials,' and included in tangible cultural properties along with 'buildings' and 'arts and crafts.'
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。material folk-culture → folklore materialsapplied arts → arts and crafts
sen.e: On this occasion, the present-day folk-cultural properties were designated as 'folklore materials,' and included in tangible cultural properties along with 'buildings' and 'arts and crafts.'

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）の文化財保護法改正（通称「第一次改正」）において、有形の民俗資料の保護に関する制度を有形文化財の指定制度から切り離し、「重要民俗資料」の指定制度が発足した。
sen.e: When the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 1954 (commonly called 'primary revision'), the protection system for tangible material folk-culture was separated from the designation system for tangiblecultural properties, and was refurbished as the designation system for 'important material folk-culture'.
sen.cmt: 第一次改正：ビジネス・科学技術 / 京都プロジェクト案件 用語集の訳を転用しています。
sen.e: When the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 1954 (commonly called 'primary revision'), the protection system for tangible material folk-culture was separated from the designation system for tangible cultural properties, and was refurbished as the designation system for 'important material folk-culture'.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: When the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 1954 (commonly called 'primary revision'), the protection system for tangible material folk-culture was separated from the designation system for tangible cultural properties, and was refurbished as the designation system for 'important material folk-culture'.

sen.j: あわせて、無形の民俗資料について「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗資料」選択制度が発足した。
sen.e: At the same time, a selection system for 'intangible material folk-culture for which records should be prepared' was introduced.
At the same time, a selection system for 'intangible folklore material for which records should be prepared' was introduced.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。material folk-culture → folklore materials
sen.e: At the same time, a selection system for 'intangible folklore material for which records should be prepared' was introduced.

sen.j: 1975年（昭和50年）の同法改正（通称「第二次改正」）では、従来の「民俗資料」が「民俗文化財」と改称されて、従来の重要民俗資料は重要有形民俗文化財と位置づけられた。
sen.e: In the revision of 1975 (commonly called 'secondary revision'), the conventional term 'material folk-culture' was renamed to 'folk-cultural properties,' and the conventional 'important material folk-culture' came to be deemed as 'important tangible folk-cultural properties.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処第二次改正：ビジネス・科学技術 / 京都プロジェクト案件 用語共有の訳を転用しています。
sen.e: In the revision of 1975 (commonly called 'secondary revision'), the conventional term 'folklore materials' was renamed to 'folk-cultural properties,' and the conventional 'important folklore materials' came to be deemed as 'important tangible folk-cultural properties.'
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。material folk-culture → folklore materials
sen.e: In the revision of 1975 (commonly called 'secondary revision'), the conventional term 'folklore materials' was renamed to 'folk-cultural properties,' and the conventional 'important folklore materials' came to be deemed as 'important tangible folk-cultural properties.'

sen.j: また、新たに重要無形民俗文化財の指定制度が設けられるなど、民俗文化財制度が整備された。
sen.e: In addition, a new designation system for 'important intangible folk-cultural properties' was introduced to complement the folk-cultural properties system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, a new designation system for 'important intangible folk-cultural properties' was introduced to complement the folk-cultural properties system.
In addition, a new designation system for 'important intangible folk-cultural properties' was introduced to complement the folk-cultural properties system.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）の同法改正施行において、重要有形民俗文化財指定制度を補完する登録有形民俗文化財制度が発足した。
sen.e: In the revision and enforcement of the law in 2005, a system for registered tangible folk-cultural properties was started to complement the designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties system.

In the revision and enforcement of the law in 2005, a system for registered tangible folk-cultural properties was started to complement the designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties system.

In the revision and enforcement of the law in 2005, a system for registered tangible folk-cultural properties was started to complement the designation system for important tangible folk-cultural properties system.

sen.j: 現行の文化財保護法では、民俗文化財については、第2条第1項第3号で以下のように規定している。
sen.e: In the active Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, folk-cultural properties are defined in article 2, paragraph 1, item 3 as follows.
sen.cmt: 元の文は「現行の文化財保護法では、民俗文化財については、第2条第1項第3号で」のみで文章として完結していません。仕様書に従い、2つ後の文の「と規定している。」をこちらにコピーし、文章として組み立てています。
sen.e: In the active Act on Protection of Cultural Properties, folk-cultural properties are defined in article 2, paragraph 1, item 3 as follows.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: In the active Act on Protection of Cultural Properties, folk-cultural properties are defined in article 2, paragraph 1, item 3 as follows.

sen.j: 衣食住、生業、信仰、年中行事等に関する風俗慣習、民俗芸能、民俗技術及びこれらに用いられる衣服、器具、家屋その他の物件で我が国民の生活の推移の理解のため欠くことのできないもの
sen.e: Manners and customs related to food, clothing and housing, to occupations, religious faiths, annual observances, etc., folk performing arts and folk techniques, and clothes, implements, houses and other objects used therefor, which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.
sen.cmt: 文は以下を参考としていますが、民俗芸能、民俗技術の部分はこの英語訳に盛り込まれていません。こちらはfolk performing arts and folk techniquesとしています。http://www.wipo.int/tk/en//laws/pdf/japan_cultural.pdf
sen.e: Manners and customs related to food, clothing and housing, to occupations, religious faiths, annual observances, etc., folk performing arts and folk techniques, and clothes, implements, houses and other objects used therefor, which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.

Manners and customs related to food, clothing and housing, to occupations, religious faiths, annual observances, etc., folk performing arts and folk techniques, and clothes, implements, houses and other objects used therefor, which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.

sen.j: これは、1954年改正時の条文に「民俗芸能」（1975年改正時追加）と「民俗技術」（2004年改正時追加）を付け加わえたものである。
sen.e: In this law, 'folk performing arts' (added in the revision in 1975) and 'folk techniques' (added in the revision in 2004) are added to the law revised in 1954.
In this law, 'folk performing arts' (added in the revision in 1975) and 'folk techniques' (added in the revision in 2004) are added to the law revised in 1954.
In this law, 'folk performing arts' (added in the revision in 1975) and 'folk techniques' (added in the revision in 2004) are added to the law revised in 1954.

sen.j: 日本では、有形の民俗文化財のうち特に重要なものを重要有形民俗文化財として国が指定し、保護措置を講じている。
sen.e: In Japan, the Government designates especially important items of tangible folk-cultural properties as important tangible folk-cultural properties, and takes protective measures.
In Japan, the Government designates especially important items of tangible folk-cultural properties as important tangible folk-cultural properties, and takes protective measures.
In Japan, the Government designates especially important items of tangible folk-cultural properties as important tangible folk-cultural properties, and takes protective measures.

As of March 11, 2009, the following 207 items are designated.
As of March 11, 2009, the following 207 items are designated.

sen.j: 人の一生に関して用いられるもの （3件）

sen.j: 地方公共団体も、同様に「有形民俗文化財」として指定をおこなっている。
sen.e: The local public bodies also designate 'tangible folk-cultural properties.'
The local public bodies also designate 'tangible folk-cultural properties.'
The local public bodies also designate 'tangible folk-cultural properties.'

sen.j: 2004年の文化財保護法改正によって民俗文化財の登録制度が発足し、国または地方公共団体の指定を受けていない有形民俗文化財のうち、保存と活用が特に必要なものを登録有形民俗文化財として登録することになった。
sen.e: When the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 2004, a registration system for folk-cultural properties was introduced, enabling tangible folk-cultural properties that require special preservation and utilization among those not designated by the Government or the local public bodies as such to be registered as registered tangible cultural properties.

When the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 2004, a registration system for folk-cultural properties was introduced, enabling tangible folk-cultural properties that require special preservation and utilization among those not designated by the Government or the local public bodies as such to be registered as registered tangible cultural properties.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: When the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties was revised in 2004, a registration system for folk-cultural properties was introduced, enabling tangible folk-cultural properties that require special preservation and utilization among those not designated by the Government or the local public bodies as such to be registered as registered tangible cultural properties.

sen.e: In Japan, the Government designates especially important items among intangible folk-cultural properties as important intangible folk-cultural properties and takes protective measures.
In Japan, the Government designates especially important items among intangible folk-cultural properties as important intangible folk-cultural properties and takes protective measures.
In Japan, the Government designates especially important items among intangible folk-cultural properties as important intangible folk-cultural properties and takes protective measures.

sen.j: 都道府県や市町村も、同様に「無形民俗文化財」として指定をおこなっている。
sen.e: Prefectural governments and local municipalities also designate 'intangible folk-cultural properties.'
Prefectural governments and local municipalities also designate 'intangible folk-cultural properties.'
Prefectural governments and local municipalities also designate 'intangible folk-cultural properties.'

sen.j: 重要無形民俗文化財以外の無形の民俗文化財のうち特に必要のあるものを文化庁長官が「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗文化財」（通称選択無形民俗文化財）として選択し、地方公共団体の行う調査事業や記録作成の事業に助成を行っている。
sen.e: When especially necessary, the Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects folk-cultural properties among those other than important intangible folk-cultural properties as 'intangible folk-cultural properties for which records should be prepared' (commonly-called selected intangible folk-cultural properties), and supports researches and recording conducted by local public bodies.

When especially necessary, the Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects folk-cultural properties among those other than important intangible folk-cultural properties as 'intangible folk-cultural properties for which records should be prepared' (commonly-called selected intangible folk-cultural properties), and supports researches and recording conducted by local public bodies.

When especially necessary, the Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects folk-cultural properties among those other than important intangible folk-cultural properties as 'intangible folk-cultural properties for which records should be prepared' (commonly-called selected intangible folk-cultural properties), and supports researches and recording conducted by local public bodies.

sen.j: 日本の文化財保護法第2条第1項各号の規定によれば、文化財は以下に大別される。
sen.e: The items in the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties,article 2, paragraph 1 defines cultural properties as follows.
sen.cmt: 元の文は「日本の文化財保護法第2条第1項各号の規定によれば、文化財は]のみで文章として完結していません。仕様書に従い、7つ後の文の「と規定している。」をこちらにコピーし、文章として組み立てています。
sen.e: The items in the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties, article 2, paragraph 1 defines cultural properties as follows.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: The items in the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties, article 2, paragraph 1 defines cultural properties as follows.

sen.j: 有形文化財
sen.e: Tangible cultural properties
Tangible cultural properties
Tangible cultural properties

sen.j: 無形文化財
sen.e: Intangible cultural properties
Intangible cultural properties
Intangible cultural properties

sen.j: 民俗文化財
sen.e: Folk-cultural properties
Folk-cultural properties
Folk-cultural properties

sen.j: 記念物
sen.e: Monuments
Monuments
Monuments

sen.j: 伝統的建造物群
sen.e: Groups of historic buildings
Groups of historic buildings
Groups of historic buildings

sen.j: 文化的景観
sen.e: Cultural landscapes
Cultural scenery
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Cultural scenery

sen.j: このうち、「無形文化財」と「無形民俗文化財」の相違について説明する。
sen.e: Among these categories, the difference between 'intangible cultural properties' and 'tangible cultural properties' is explained below.
Among these categories, the difference between 'intangible cultural properties' and 'tangible cultural properties' is explained below.
Among these categories, the difference between 'intangible cultural properties' and 'tangible cultural properties' is explained below.

sen.j: 無形文化財は、文化財保護法によればこう規定されている。
sen.e: The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties states as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文は、「無形文化財は、文化財保護法によれば」のみで文章として完結していません。2つ後の文の「と規定されており、」の部分を移動し、文章として組み立てています。
sen.e: The Act on Protection of Cultural Properties defines intangible cultural properties as follows.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Propertiesstates → defines intangible cultural properties
sen.e: The Act on Protection of Cultural Properties defines intangible cultural properties as follows.

sen.j: 演劇、音楽、工芸技術その他の無形の文化的所産で我が国にとつて歴史上又は芸術上価値の高いもの
sen.e: Arts and skills employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for this country.
sen.cmt: 以下のArticle 2の部分を参考としています。http://www.wipo.int/tk/en//laws/pdf/japan_cultural.pdf
sen.e: Arts and skills employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for this country.
Arts and skills employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for this country.

sen.j: 具体的には能楽や歌舞伎、浄瑠璃などの伝統芸能や陶磁器、漆器製作などの伝統工芸である。
sen.e: Specifically, traditional performing arts such as kabuki and joruri, and traditional crafts such as manufacturing of ceramics and lacquer ware.
sen.cmt: 原文は、「と規定されており、具体的には能楽や歌舞伎、浄瑠璃などの伝統芸能や陶磁器、漆器製作などの伝統工芸である。」ですが、文頭の部分は2つ前の列に盛り込んで削除し、文章として完結させています。
sen.e: Specifically, traditional performing arts such as nogaku (the art of Noh), kabuki and joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment), and traditional crafts such as manufacturing of ceramics and lacquer ware.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れnogaku (the art of Noh)を補足しました。用語集からカッコ内を追加しました。
sen.e: Specifically, traditional performing arts such as nogaku (the art of Noh), kabuki and joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment), and traditional crafts such as manufacturing of ceramics and lacquer ware.

sen.j: ここで文化財と考えられるのは無形の「わざ（技術）」そのものであり、その「わざ」をもつ人や団体を「保持者」として認定している。
sen.e: The cultural properties here are deemed as intangible 'techniques' themselves, and the people or organizations that have such 'techniques' are certified as 'holders.'
The cultural properties here are deemed as intangible 'techniques' themselves, and the people or organizations that have such 'techniques' are certified as 'holders.'
The cultural properties here are deemed as intangible 'techniques' themselves, and the people or organizations that have such 'techniques' are certified as 'holders.'

sen.j: それに対し、民俗文化財は前述の文化財保護法にあるように次のように規定されており、歴史資料ないし史料としての側面が重視される。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties mentioned earlier states folk-cultural properties as follows, emphasizing the historical material aspect.
sen.cmt: 原文は「それに対し、民俗文化財は前述の文化財保護法にあるように」のみで文章として完結していません。2つ後の文を移動し、文章として組み立てています。また、歴史資料ないし史料はまとめてhistorical materialと表現しています。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties mentioned earlier states folk-cultural properties as follows, emphasizing the historical material aspect.
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: On the other hand, the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties mentioned earlier states folk-cultural properties as follows, emphasizing the historical material aspect.

sen.j: 我が国民の生活の推移の理解のため欠くことのできないもの
sen.e: Those which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.
sen.cmt: この条文の英訳はManners and customs related to food, clothing and housing, to occupations, religious faiths, festivals, etc., tofolk-entertainments and clothes, implements, houses and other objects used therefor, which are indispensable for theunderstanding of changes in our people's modes of life (hereinafter referred to as "folk-cultural properties");であり、原文部分のみを取りだすとwhich以下となちます。このためthoseを補っています。
sen.e: Those which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.
Those which are indispensable for the understanding of changes in our people's modes of life.

sen.j: 日本の文化財保護法においては、「無形文化財」は「高度に洗練された技術」「プロの技術」を指し、その技術をもつ特定の個人や団体が「保持者」として認定される。
sen.e: According to the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, 'intangible cultural properties' refer to 'highly sophisticated techniques' and 'professional skills,' and individuals and organizations that have such techniques and skills are certified as 'holders.'

According to the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, 'intangible cultural properties' refer to 'highly sophisticated techniques' and 'professional skills,' and individuals and organizations that have such techniques and skills are certified as 'holders.'
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: According to the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, 'intangible cultural properties' refer to 'highly sophisticated techniques' and 'professional skills,' and individuals and organizations that have such techniques and skills are certified as 'holders.'

sen.j: これに対し、「無形民俗文化財」の指定対象は風俗慣習、民俗芸能、年中行事などの一般庶民の生活、慣習、行事そのものであって、特定の個人や団体を「保持者」として認定することはない。
sen.e: On the other hand, those designated as 'intangible folk-cultural properties' are lives, customs and events of commoners themselves, such as manners and customs, folk performing arts and annual observances, for which individuals or organizations are not certified as 'holders.'

On the other hand, those designated as 'intangible folk-cultural properties' are lives, customs and events of commoners themselves, such as manners and customs, folk performing arts and annual observances, for which individuals or organizations are not certified as 'holders.'

On the other hand, those designated as 'intangible folk-cultural properties' are lives, customs and events of commoners themselves, such as manners and customs, folk performing arts and annual observances, for which individuals or organizations are not certified as 'holders.'

sen.j: それゆえ、日本の文化財保護法においては、無形民俗文化財はあくまでも「民俗文化財」の範疇に含まれるのであり、「無形文化財」には属さない。
sen.e: For this reason, in the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, intangible folk-cultural properties are persistently categorized into 'folk-cultural properties' instead of 'intangible cultural properties.'

For this reason, in the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, intangible folk-cultural properties are persistently categorized into 'folk-cultural properties' instead of 'intangible cultural properties.'
sen.cmt: Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties → Act on Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: For this reason, in the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, intangible folk-cultural properties are persistently categorized into 'folk-cultural properties' instead of 'intangible cultural properties.'

sen.j: ただし、世界無形遺産では、日本におけるような「無形文化財」と「無形民俗文化財」の区別は設けていない。
sen.e: However, unlike the Japanese law that distinguishes 'intangible cultural properties' from 'intangible folk-cultural properties', Intangible Cultural Heritage does not differentiate the two.
However, unlike the Japanese law that distinguishes 'intangible cultural properties' from 'intangible folk-cultural properties', Intangible Cultural Heritage does not differentiate the two.
However, unlike the Japanese law that distinguishes 'intangible cultural properties' from 'intangible folk-cultural properties', Intangible Cultural Heritage does not differentiate the two.
